questions.question_text:
An administrator notices that a cloud pod is not in the correct site.
What can be done to solve this issue?

choices.C: Under Settings > Cloud Pod Architecture, select the pod, click edit and select the correct site.
choices.B: Under Settings > sites, select the site, and select move pod to this site.
choices.D: Under Settings > sites, select the pod, click edit, and select the correct site from the menu.
choices.A: Under Settings > Cloud Pod Architecture, select the pod and change the name of the site.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct Settings > Sites > Pod > Select Pod > Edit > Select the correct site.

questions.question_text:
End-users are complaining that they are frequently being asked for credentials when opening additional apps.
Which step should the administrator take to resolve the issue?

choices.B: Configure Session Timeout by modifying the Client Settings in Horizon Client.
choices.C: Configure a time limit by modifying the Horizon GPO.
choices.A: Configure SSO Timeout by modifying the Global Settings in Horizon Administrator.
choices.D: Configure Desktop Timeout by modifying the Pool Settings in Horizon Administrator.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Configure SSO Timeout by modifying the Global Settings in Horizon Administrator.

Which steps should the administrator take to meet the requirements? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Disable the Allow External Website feature in Horizon Agent.

choices.A: Enable the URL Content Redirection feature on the desktop pool settings.
choices.C: Configure group policy settings to indicate how Horizon Agent redirects the URL.
choices.B: Enable the URL Content Redirection feature in Horizon Agent.
